meanings.definition: The act of officially ending or stopping something, especially a law or practice.
meanings.sent1: The abolition of the outdated rule brought relief to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The abolition of the harmful law was celebrated by the community.
meanings.sent3: The abolition of the no-dessert rule at school made the students very happy.
meanings.sent4: The abolition of the strict dress code was like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The abolition of the curfew made the city feel alive again.

meanings.sent1: The abolition fought tirelessly for the freedom of all people.
meanings.sent2: The abolition worked together to bring an end to slavery.
meanings.sent3: The abolitionists' dedication to their cause was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent4: The abolition of slavery was a monumental step towards equality.
meanings.sent5: The abolition movement sparked hope for a better future for all.
